inn1.comm: Warner takes first strike today and allows a length ball to zip through in the channel a foot outside off
slightly shorter length, Warner jumps back on off stump and shows it a straight bat
shortish outside off, 139kph but it sits up nicely for Warner to muscle down the ground, a flick of the broadsword and it beats mid-off
good length, 142kph and rising in the channel outside off, lets this one go
draws him into an ill-judged poke, served up quite wide with a scrambled seam, maybe a bit of extra bounce past the outside edge
superb delivery, beats the bat again, this arched in and then dipped away, not much Warner could do about that other than miss it
angled in with the arm, slightly back of a length and hits Finch on the pad trying to play to leg
pitched up outside off, moves across tentatively and punches to cover
on the stumps, 134kph and worked to mid-on without timing
Rabada's still a little too straight and Finch clips this squarer, past mid-on for a couple
length ball on off stump, 140kph and blocked back down the track
on the pads, drifting in without any swing back the other way and Finch helps himself to a snacksize four off his legs, beats fine leg running around
short and wide and bludged through the covers by Warner, a dismissive slap for four
back of a length, doesn't get hold of this one, cut towards backward point
crikey, that's gone the journey! Steyn drops short and Warner is swiftly back on his toes to swing a haymaker blow, sends it soaring all the way into the crowd at deep midwicket, several rows back!
pitched up and clubbed over cover, in the air but in front of the man - four more!
slightly short outside off, Warner steers a couple more through backward point, placement rather than power
good length, 144kph outside off, drops back and glides one to third man
well-directed from Rabada, full and shaping back a touch from over the wicket, Warner chops down on it
tight on off stump, Warner deftly drops it in front of mid-off and makes the single comfortably
banged in, 145kph but veering down the leg side...
on the legs and Finch flicks uppishly over backward square, that's another item from the buffet for him
good pace, again leg side but this beats the inside edge and thumps the thigh pad
middle-and-off stump line, 138kph from the Gazelle of Doom, thuds into the padding again - but high
Rabada throws up his hands in frustration as Finch inside-edges a fullish inducker on to his pads and away through backward square
length ball, strays on to the pads, Finch diverts it down towards fine leg
comes across on off stump and defends a length ball
shortish, on the body and Finch glances through backward square leg
back of a length, tries to work across the line and gets a leading edge... but it doesn't carry back to the bowler
good length, 133kph on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
bit of shape back in, 138kph and flicked with a turn of the wrists through square
full and a touch straight, Warner uses the pace but manages to pick out midwicket
gets hold of this one, 141kph on the stumps but Warner's reflexes are equal to it, fast-twitch fibres firing as he clubs over square leg
smashed down the ground this time, bounces just short of the rope! Warner has picked up the hammer and is bringing it down hard
in the channel, steers into the covers coming forwards
bit of width and Warner throws the hands through a slash to third man
full on the stumps, Finch happy to pootle along in Warner's wake, glances through midwicket
angled across and Warner slices through backward point - that's the 50 up, in no time
on the stumps, Finch dabs down into the leg side but they think better of trying to steal one
slightly back of a length outside off, 142kph and prodded to extra cover on the back foot
lets slip a slower ball... that goes a-wandering well down the leg side
lummy, that's an extraordinary shot! Finch takes on a length ball, steps out and plays a lofted flick to leg... and clears the rope at deep midwicket! Nonchalantly done
short ball, pulled - nay, hammered - flat over deep midwicket for six more! More pain for Steyn, Finch blasting a half-tracker over the fence in agricultural style
better line and length, Finch settles for blocking
good length and rising in the channel as Warner goes for the big'un down the ground, fails to connect
beats the outside edge again, this time Warner looking to dab at it from the crease
slower  ball, bounces a bit higher and Warner can only nudge to midwicket - nicely bowled
dug in at serious pace, 147kph and Warner turns his head away as he pulls... comes high off the top edge but clears short fine leg and bounces away! Fortune favouring the bravado here
on the stumps, poked into the covers and they run through
crumped back down the ground, runs past mid-on and they will get back for a third as the throw comes in
pitched up and slugged back down the ground first ball, a terrific diving stop from mid-off prevents four
fullish, on the stumps and punched to mid-on
hits through the line, Pretorius is a wee bit slower than Steyn and Rabada and Warner was through the shot early but still managed to clear mid-on running back
pushed across on off stump, 134kph and tapped into the covers
tight lines, Warner steers it square and bellows "No!"
good length on off, 134kph and again Warner can only jab it towards point - decent introduction from Pretorius
Rabada continues, slightly short outside off and Finch tries to cut... inside-edged past his stumps and de Kock is wrong-footed, that will go to the fence as well
goes back outside off and steers a couple more wide of third man
on the stumps, clipped firmly to leg but midwicket grabs it
fired in quick and straight and Rabada goes up for lbw, only to belatedly realise that Finch got some bat on it
short outside off, canny batting from Finch, he jumps back and uses the pace, ramping fine of third man... all the way for six! That's the fifth of the innings so far
touch back of a length, 140kph on the stumps, defended this time
pitched up outside off, Warner leans into a business-like crunch down the ground, beats long-off running across! Giddy up!
length on the stumps, pulled flat and hard but straight to midwicket
134kph on middle and leg, clipped through square
full on the stumps and again worked off the legs to the man on the fence
pitched up and poked towards mid-off coming forwards, a misfield gifts them a single
tight lines from Pretorius, blocked
scuttles in and floats the ball on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up outside off stump, Warner stiffs one down the ground to long-off
flighted, straightening on the stumps, controlled paddle through backward square leg
targets the leg-side boundary, a flat sort of slog-sweep-drive and it's into the gap between deep mdiwicket and long-on - brutish stuff and Warner has his fifty, from 41 balls
tossed up a bit slower outside off, pushed to cover
finishes with the googly, as Warner comes out, covers the line and blocks
beats the bat, decent line from Pretorius, maybe a bit of nibble as Finch stays back and swishes at it
slightly short and this is rifled off the back foot to deep point, where Amla tumbles to make a good stop

pitched up and fetched into the crowd, another breezy tinkle over the fence from Finch, walloped into the crowd at long-on (well caught, too) and that takes him to an even quicker half-century, from 32 balls
on the stumps, maybe an offcutter, worked through the leg side
good length on middle and off, turned to midwicket
beats the bat, Warner glanced back furtively as he tried to dab to third man, didn't get anything on it

launched into the sky, but it lobs to mid-off, Tahir makes the breakthrough! One big hit too many for Finch, sent it pretty much straight up and he has to head straight off, as Tahir weaves away in trademark arms-whirling high-fiving celebration. Twas the googly that did it
floated up outside off, Warner clubs it down the ground
flighted, around off stump, Smith props forward to block
tosses up the legbreak, Smith leans out and gets an inside edge defending
very full, outside off and squeezed through the covers on the drive
on the stumps, possibly the googly and Smith turns it around the corner to backward square leg
Pretorius puts the ball on a length, pushed back down the ground
tight stuff, 129kph but Smith moves on to off stump and blocks again
wicket-to-wicket stuff, Smith happy to get his eye in
slower ball this time, Smith had wandered outside off and was looking to work to leg, gets a leading edge
fullish on the stumps and this time he gets the leg glance working
touch back of a length and Warner stays on top of the bounce to punch one more to deep cover
tossed up on middle and leg, Warner pushes to long-on
tossed up outside off, Smith pats it away defensively
goes back in the crease and works a length ball behind square on the leg side
legbreak on the stumps, stays in the crease and flicks off his hip
tossed up, Smith drives a bump ball back to the bowler, Tahir clinging on running to his left
slower delivery, Smith waits and works one more off his pads behind square to keep the strike
pitched up on the stumps, Smith punches back down the ground
comes across to drive a length ball square, brilliant pick up and throw from Rossouw, had Smith hurrying
on the stumps, Smith nurdles one more through the leg side
fullish, in the channel, driven through the covers coming forward
shuffles across on off and drills another single down the ground to long-on
angled across, 135kph and Warner steers another single through the covers - all gone a bit pedestrian after the destruction derby of the opening ten. Consolidation time
whipped out to deep square
back of a length outside off, Smith on his toes and punched to point
well bowled, this nips back off the seam and beats Smith's inside edge as he plays away from his body
a shorter delivery, rolls his wrists and pulls to deep square
that's a loose delivery, short again, down the leg side, Warner pulls and I think it comes off the glove so doesn't have much pace on it which allows long leg to get around
punched sweetly off the back foot to cover, there's a fumble but they can't steal a single
plays back and defends to midwicket
width outside off, Smith gives himself a touch of room and drives square through the covers
goes back and drives to cover
fuller, drilled down to long-off
whips a full ball from outside off down to long-on
round the wicket, full and straight, defended to the leg side
length ball outside off, defended into the covers
throws his hands through some width and slices the ball down to third man
big appeal for lbw as he goes for the pull, the ball skids on more than imagined, but did it pitch outside leg? They decide not to review. Was above the knee roll as well
that's crunched! Some power there from Warner, drags a short ball from outside off thunderously through midwicket. Fielders barely moved
slower ball, nudged to midwicket
short on leg stump, tucked off the hip down to long leg
opens the face a touch and drives wide of the cover man inside the circle
pushed into midwicket from outside off
touch short outside off, chopped into the ground and it rolls towards cover...it's a tight-ish single, but Warner is so quick
nearly drags this on...aiming a drive through the covers, he was through his shot a fraction early, takes a thick inside edge between his legs
pushed down the ground
drives this in the air, but it goes just wide of cover...stopped his shot, perhaps the ball stopped a little, but he was just able to get it wide of the fielder
a loopy bouncer which is called wide
full at the stumps, defended back to the bowler
opens the face and punches square off the back foot
full outside off, picks out backward point as he drives
on a length outside off, defended to cover
full outside off, good pressure being built, Smith defends towards mid-off
goes onto the back foot and steers a back-of-a-length ball through the off side
pushed off the back foot to long-on
stretches forward and pushes back to the bowler
driven off the back foot to deep cover
defends on the walk to cover
dragged down short, Smith swings away a pull stroke, beats square leg and gets his first boundary
pushed down the ground to long-on
doesn't quite get his timing as he drives to cover
very full outside off, driven to deep cover
pushed down the leg side, de Kock does well to get his right-hand mit down to it
a slower ball, full and straight, pushed to the covers
down the leg side again, more tumbling for de Kock to do
back outside off stump, it's a sweetly-struck square drive but he picks out backward point
full ball at off stump, squeezed off a thick outside edge to backward point
played off the back foot through the off side, good placement wide of the sweeper allows him back for a second
full outside off, comes forward and drives through the covers
round the wicket, full outside off, driven hard towards cover who parries it away as he dives
goes back outside leg to a shorter ball and cuts to deep point
very full, jabbed to the off side
worked into the leg side where midwicket gets across
opens the face, drives to cover...a decent period for South Africa continues
full outside off, driven to cover, well fielded by David Miller
opens the face and drives through point
slower ball outside off, pushed down the ground
comes forward and defends square to point
brings his bottom hand into play as he whips this from outside off down to long leg
takes advantage of some width outside and drives square but Amla is able to get around the cover boundary
more work for Amla at deep cover, this time to get around to intercept Smith's drive which was almost placed well enough to find the boundary
short outside off, cut to deep cover
played out to deep cover
full and straight, Warner can't beat the bowler with his drive
worked off the pads into square leg
round the wicket, pushed across Smith who drives to deep cover
driven on the up to cover
drives a fraction early at a googly, takes a thick inside edge
fuller, driven straight back past the stumps and long-off comes around
excellent fielding to back up the bowler, was dropped a touch short outside off, Warner cuts but Rossouw flings himself to his left

another South Africa fielder flinging himself around, the captain this time, and du Plessis almost manages to create a brilliant run out as he back-hand flips the ball towards the non-striker's stumps with Smith well short
dabbed behind square
almost drags this on, it's a full ball outside off, his feet don't move much and he's playing away from his body but the toe end dribbles wide of the stumps
full and straight, driven to long-off
that's sweet from Smith, stands tall and drives between cover and mid-off...super piece of timing
worked down to long-on
stand and deliver! Jeepers, that went like a rocket. Full ball outside off, a touch slower, and Warner clubs it straight down the ground
he's kicking on again, deft touch this time as he opens the face and steers this smartly wide of backward point towards third man. That's classy
back of a length at off stump, defended
shuffles across the crease and pulls a back-of-a-length delivery to long leg
driven out to deep cover
takes the pace off a little, Smith plays back to the bowler

big appeal for lbw, this looks tight! Smith shuffling across his stumps again, aiming to the leg side with a bottom-hand shovel, and Steyn was pleading. But they don't review. Line and height an issue
that's dispatched, dragged shorter and wider by Steyn, Smith doesn't miss out as he drives behind square with power and placement
full at off stump, gets forward and defends
drives behind point with an open face
can't beat the off side as he drives
missed stumping, that could be a huge moment! Was a very full ball, Warner aimed to work it to leg, glanced off the back pad towards de Kock with Warner well down the crease
driven to deep cover...that's Australia's 200
tucked away from leg stump to midwicket
length ball at off stump, pushed towards the mid-on area and it's judge as a sharp single with midwicket unable to get across
whips a length ball into midwicket
punched through the off side
throws his hands through a wide delivery, was aiming over point but it flies off a thick top edge fine of third man...takes him to 99
there's his hundred! Knocks the ball down by his feet and Smith calls him through. A superb innings, 96 balls, and still plenty of time left
worked off the body to deep square
uses his feet then whips along the ground through midwicket
short outside off, cut through point and wide of the cover sweeper
driven off the front foot this time, and again the sweeper can't cut off the second
fantastic piece of fielding at cover by Miller as he flings himself low to his left to cut off a rifled cover drive
plays this straighter, down to long-off
driven to long-off,,,brings up his fifty
starts with a short ball but gets away with it as he crunches it to cover
doesn't escape this short ball as Smith rocks back and pulls a long hop over midwicket...that was a bit of freebie rubbish
outside off, flat-batted to deep cover
goes for the reverse sweep, misses, and it's well taken by de Kock...glanced off the back arm
steps outside leg and then hammers this towards cover who can't stop it cleanly and although the ball barely left the fielding circle Warner comes back for a second
gets across onto off stump then sweeps but picks out short fine leg
goes back outside off and steers a drive through cover point
that's outrageous from Warner, opening up now, essays a sort of reverse-slog-sweep and scoops the ball high over backward point, bounces away to the fence
slogged conventionally this time - and it goes all the way! Tossed up and creamed into the stands at deep midwicket. Think Warner heard Gnasher's call...
pushed across and tapped into the covers

slogs again, but this one won't clear the rope... well taken by long-on running in! Tahir finally induces another mistake, having got Finch earlier, but Warner has played a superb knock. Was looking to plant Tahir into the stands again but went pretty much straight up
googly, spinning in on the stumps, worked back down the ground
shortish on the stumps, worked through square leg
good length, 133kph on the stumps, squirted towards mid-on from the crease
back of a length, dropped into the covers, this is going to be tight.... Miller swoops, Smith would have been well gone, but the underarm is off target! Smith had given up
played back down the track
shortish, 137kph outside off, defended into the off side
back of a length outside off, pulls across the line but the ball shoots through under the bat
looped up outside off, Bailey gets the reverse-hit going, top-edges fine of short third man and Smith runs hard for three
tossed up and punched towards mid-off
quicker ball, beats the outside edge as Smith goes back to cut
quick and flat, comes forward to drive, Tahir gets fingertips to it
flighted, Bailey gets forward and drives through the covers
slow loopy legbreak outside off, Bailey drops back and steers one more through point
length ball, 137kph outside off, steered through backward point
sliding on to the pads, Bailey clips behind square and they get back for two
140kph but fired down the leg side
slightly short outside off, Bailey dabs it to backward point
steps out to loft over the infield, slightly screwed to leg but it plops safely to earth
loses his line down the leg side once again
pitched up on off, punched short into the off side
terrific bit of work on the boundary from Amla here, chasing a leg glance full pelt along the rope and just managing to flick it back and save a run
Lucky puts the ball on the spot outside off, Bailey pushes towards mid-off for one
waits in the crease and flicks to leg, into a gap and they come back for a second
good length, 136kph on the stumps, punched back past the bowler
slightly short, flapped through mid-on on the pull
slower ball, slightly short and leg side, Smith spoons it up towards backward square leg... and gets away with it, no one near as it lands
deals with the full toss, Bailey sends his first boundary scudding flat and hard through backward point. Puts a cherry on the over
good length outside off, 136kph and stabbed into the covers
digs this in, very short and slightly leg side, Smith watches it through
length outside off, 139kph and dropped short into the off side for a strolled single
leg-side yorker from Rabada, following the batsman, hits Bailey on the boot as he swings across the line
full and straight again, this time Bailey chops it into the leg side
touch back of a length, 143kph and rising outside off, Smith steers it to backward point
too leg side from Rabada and Smith cashes in, skelping four down to fine leg with a swish of the blade
starts with a cutter, outside off and it sits up to be larruped through point to the sweeper
fired in as Bailey skips out, gets a sort of bottom-edgey chop away through mid-on
short, another slower ball, Smith waits and panhandles it down through midwicket for one
full pace, touch too straight and Bailey whips what was effectively a half-volley all the way over the rope at deep midwicket... Sweetly timed

got him, brilliant catch in the covers! Lucky's slower ball does the trick, though Bailey must have thought he'd collared it, opening the shoulders and slapping in front of square, only for du Plessis to hurl himself to his left and cling on to a pearler two-handed
sprayed down the leg side, must have flicked the pad on its way through
tossed up on the stumps, Smith advances and flicks through midwicket
slightly short, stays low and pulls into a gap, again they hustle back for two
quicker outside off, drops back and splunks a drive in front of deep cover, good running again
ooh, that's a beauty, Adam Zampa will have noted the turn for Tahir there, spinning a legbreak sharply past the outside edge as Smith played from the crease
tossed up on the stumps, nurdled through backward square leg
slower, flights the legbreak on middle and leg stump, rolls away off the pad
slower ball, outside off and steered towards backward point with an open face
dismissively done, the arms windmilling through, Smith takes a length ball from off stump and swings it high over deep square leg... Not the way to make friends with Dale Steyn
maybe a touch slower, dabbed down into the covers this time
tip and run, struck rather firmly towards mid-off, Marsh has to get a shift on... the throw misses!
fullish outside off and driven past extra cover to the sweeper
digs in the bouncer at 141kph and Smith clubs it cross-batted down to long-on
whipped off the legs, Smith thought there was a second in the offing - but no
tossed up on the stumps and pushed to mid-on
gives it some air, Marsh goes down and sweeps hard, fails to connect
tossed up and punched down the ground to long-off
pushed through, slightly short outside off, Smith drops back to cut through point
flighted, straightening on off, Marsh presses forward with bat next to pad - Tahir finishes with a mighty respectable 2 for 54 from his 10
shortish outside off, steered through point on the back foot, that's the Aussie 300 up

short ball, Marsh cracks a pull... only to be bagged by another great catch at midwicket! Miller the man on this occasion, diving low to his left and clinging on to give Steyn a wicket and just check Australia's momentum a fraction
easier said than done, though, as Steyn bounces him by way of hello
full and wide, pushed across the lefty from over the wicket, dragged down the ground to long-off
back of a length and flicked off the hip to deep-backward square leg
short outside off, Head swings across the line, gets a bottom edge... and it will squirtle away to the boundary, beating fine leg and leaving Steyn with a bit of a funk on
starts with a short ball, well outside off and Smith almost leaps to swing a top edge away over short third man, scoots to the fence to take him to 94
lashed through point, lovely stroke, authentic square drive and it's back-to-back boundaries for Smith, two shy of his hundred now
short ball, steps out and swipes across the line, doesn't quite get hold of it and Lucky chases it to midwicket to keep them to one
shortish, at the body and pulled flat through square leg for one

full outside off, Smith steps out and crunches another boundary, a crisp drive in front of square - off comes the helmet in celebration of his sixth ODI hundred, and a timely one given Australia's circumstances
short outside off, maybe a slower ball, Smith opens up and clouts one out towards the cover sweeper
Smith's strike rate rises smoothly above 100 as he steps across and whirls Steyn away over backward square leg for four more

bowled him, Smith misses a slower ball! He tucks his bat under his arm and walks off, a fantastic knock but he won't go any further... Made a bit of room and was looking to steer through the covers, done by the lack of pace as Steyn sent a cutter into off stump
comes forward and pushes a single through mid-on to get off the mark first ball
length ball on the stumps, Head heaves across the line and gets a single to deep midwicket
angled across, length ball taken on the up by Wade, steered through cover
tries to hit over the top, flat-batted and coming off the top edge but it clears mid-off for a couple
short ball, slightly leg side and Wade swings violently up and over the rope, the ball flying in an arc for six over fine leg
rolls the fingers over the ball, full and wide of the stumps and squeezed through point
short ball, pulled in the air, Phehlukwayo is running in off the rope... but he drops it! Tough chance as he ran in but looked like he made the ground
short again and this is spanked over midwicket, doesn't quite have the legs to go all the way but four more to the total
gets away with a full toss as Head steps to leg, swings and misses
pushed across, 139kph and a touch full, slapped through point and they hurtle back for two
slightly back of a length, makes room and swats a pull down the ground
slower ball, Head picks it up, launches a slog towards cow... all the way! Takes Australia past 350 with another sweet-and-sour (for the bowler) strike into the crowd
full outside off and crashed through the covers this time, that'll be four more!
pitched up and dug out through mid-on for one
length ball, possibly a cutter, Wade is forward and in position to ramp the ball, nearly a catchable chance to fine leg but he can't quite get there running in
and still the runs continue to flow, a full-blooded mow down the ground bringing Wade four more, a full ball in the slot and clubbed over the infield
makes a bit of room, swats a single through point
cuts his fingers over the ball, full outside off and Wade can't get under it, one down the ground
full and straight but slugged back down the ground, Rabada fractionally misses his mark and Head slams it for four
gets this one up a bit further towards the blockhole, dug out back past the bowler and they scamper a couple
slower-ball bouncer, loops and dips and beats Head's swing across the line

full toss to finish and Head top-edges a slog pretty much straight up, Rabada running across to his right to take the catch - although he almost collides with du Plessis running in from cover! They check the delivery for height but it's just the right side of a no-ball, so the innings finishes with a wicket, Head and Wade's rambunctious partnership finally curtailed

inn2.comm: full, wide outside off, driven to cover
that's a lovely piece of a timing, a punchy drive through the covers as Tremain over-pitches outside off
tries to adjust his line, gets to straight, hint of swing takes it down the leg side

back outside off, another flowing drive from de Kock although not quite timed so well this time...deep point gets around. And, well, Amla's bat got stuck in the ground as he tried to run it in and a direct hit might have been out. What a way that would have been to go
threading the off side, this time straight to the sweeper
works a straight delivery to mid-on
uses his bottom hand to tuck a delivery off the stumps out to deep square
on a length outside off, moves way late but Amla holds his bat inside the line
full outside off, strongly driven to square cover
back of a length at off stump, 144kph/89mph, defended
angled into the pads, worked into square leg
round the wicket, full at off stump, plays forward and pushes to mid-on
nips in off a good length and brings a big appeal for lbw, looked high and maybe outside the line...hmm, touch closer than it looked. On the knee roll
full at off stump, takes something of a leading edge along the ground through cover
tucks a straight delivery to deep square leg
round the wicket, on off stump, worked to mid-on
fuller this time, flicked but he can't beat mid-on
picking it off his pads again as Tremain gets a little too straight
nicely timed through the leg side, using the angle into him, flicked in front of square but it's hauled in by Adam Zampa
aiming to work a back-of-a-length delivery to the leg side and gets a thick outside edge which loops over the bowler and short of mid-off
and now there's a leading edge from de Kock as he aims to work Worrall to the leg side and ball shoots through point
drives on the up at a length delivery and finds cover
makes something out of this as he walks right across his stumps then whips a back-of-a-length delivery over short fine leg
and now he's timed that superbly square of the wicket, on his toes and punches it at the top of the bounce behind point
brilliant batting! Worrall tries to correct himself, goes to full, Amla latches on with a crisp cover drive which is through the covers before anyone barely moved. He's up and running
smart work at backward point by Warner as he dives to cut off de Kock's open-faced guide
slower ball outside off, defeats Amla as he aims through the off side
beaten again, this time he goes over the top of the ball as he tries to cut
slips onto the pads and that's timed beautifully through midwicket as Amla just leans on his flick shot...no brute force in that
there's more power in that! Dropped in short and Amla dispatches it with a fierce front-foot pull over midwicket
gets away with this one, it's full and angling onto the pads, flicked firmly by Amla but straight to short fine leg
beaten as he tries to drive on the up
drives powerfully but the ball slides off the face to short third man
drags the length back, on off stump, de Kock defends it down by his feet
trying to flick this through the leg side again and it's a leading edge through backward point
opens the face and runs it to third man
this one gets through him, some zip off the pitch, angles back at de Kock from round the wicket and goes under his bottom edge
that's thrashed over the off side, a short ball which Amla deliberately lifts over the covers and it's not far from going all the way
goes for the pull this time, comes from high on the bat and just has the legs to clear mid-on then skips away over the outfield
slower ball outside off, guided down to third man
nearly gets this down to third man, which is unprotected, as he back-cuts a short ball but Warner just gets across from backward point
fuller, at the stumps, flicked to midwicket
short of a length, punched off the back foot into the covers
that has climbed off the surface from back of a length and beaten Amla's expansive drive
carved down to third man
worked from outside off into the leg side, feeding Amla the strike
full and straight, whipped to midwicket
the bottom hand comes off the bat as he drives this over the off side but it's well clear of the infield and he collects another boundary
that's lovely batting, just eases a straight delivery through midwicket with a bottom-handed flip...it's flying off Amla's bat
he gets this through the off side with a drive, the sweeper is able to get around
width outside off and square driven to the point sweeper
breakthrough! Big John Hastings has done it. Amla across his crease again, aiming to the leg side and is taken on the back leg. He opts not to review. Umpire's call on impact
worked towards mid-on
round the wicket, defended into the leg side
that's an excellent piece of batting, he was almost cramped for room as the ball angled in at him but was still able to slice it away wide of short third man
full, angled down the leg side
on middle, defended back to the bowler
comes forward into a punchy on drive
driven off the back foot to the covers
touch of extra bounce from back of a length, du Plessis looks a little surprised by that as he spars into the off side
finds the gap this time, short of a length outside off, just a little turn of the face to bisect the space in the off-side ring
heaved into the leg side, a touch more ungainly on that occasion
slower ball on off stump, punched to deep cover
driven out to deep cover
played out to deep cover again
short outside off from round the wicket, cut through point, got over the top of the bounce
stays on leg stump which opens up the off side and that means a ball that wasn't that wide can be slotted through point
plays a straight delivery to the off side
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to deep cover
full and straight, steered through the off side to deep cover
that's a meaty blow, fetches it from full outside off and heaves it over wide mid-on...the face closed on his hands but he retained control of the shot
full outside off, jabbed to deep cover
back of a length, 134kph, pushed back towards the bowler
opens the face and dabs a length ball behind point
full and straight, defended to cover
off the back foot, driven to the off-side sweeper
full outside off, angled down to third man from a controlled outside edge
angled into the pads, can't work it away
full at off stump, a slower ball, driven down to long-off
round the wicket, short of a length, de Kock tries to pull it away but the ball skims under his bat and isn't that far from taking leg stump
dabbed into the off side
that's de Kock at his best! Another slower ball, full outside off, he picks it and drives it clear over long-off...handsome way to reach three figures
out to the cover sweeper
full on the stumps, drives to mid-on
picks up a back-of-a-length delivery outside off and plays a skimming pull off the front foot well in front of square...and even came off low down the bat, still raced to deep midwicket
can't angle this wide of backward point
that's another pristine drive by de Kock, full outside off, and it's played all along the ground between cover and mid-off
goes back to a short ball and almost swings himself off his feet as he hoicks towards midwicket
short again, du Plessis rocks back and pulls this in the air over midwicket, one bounce to the boundary
on the stumps, driven to deep cover
gets this one fuller, flicked down to long-on
beats point as he drives square and the brace means it's 13 off Zampa's first over
swept from outside leg stump down to fine leg and that takes de Kock to a 36-ball fifty
dragged down short and hammered over deep midwicket...that was a rubbish delivery
now he steps to the leg side and drives through the covers, wide of the sweeper
round the wicket, full outside off, drives off a thick outside edge fine of short third man
pushed down the ground
pushed into the off side
dropped and there was the chance! Given a touch more air, lured into the drive, and it was sharp to Smith's left at cover. Not easy, but need to be taken
played out to deep cover
comes forward and drives to cover
flipped over the leg side out to deep midwicket
worked off the pads into square leg
round the wicket, tossed up on the stumps, punched down the ground to long-on
drops short, du Plessis shovels to the leg side... but picks out deep midwicket! Not the acme of shot selection there (other than in the Warner Bros sense) and Warner roars in celebration
tossed up and pushed back down the ground
comes forward and dribbles a drive through mid-on
shouts from the bowler as he gets one to grip a bit, nudged into the covers
low full toss and that spoils an otherwise decent over as de Kock swats it through deep-backward square leg for a boundary
round the wicket, shortish and Rossouw pulls, gets a bottom edge to Wade's right, he dives after it and does really well to prevent a run
pitched up a bit further, comes forward and strokes through the covers
length on off, dropped into the off side, easy single there
on the stumps, worked back towards the bowler
touch too straight from Tremain and Rossouw works it off his legs
short and pulled, de Kock miscues this slightly but he was aiming for the big gap at cow and the top edge lands safely between two men
floated up on off stump, Rossouw taps it back through mid-off
flat outside off, bit of width and de Kock slides a cut away through point
tossed up, closer to the stumps and Rossouw opens the face to drive square
de Kock gets on to the front foot and pushes another single through point
there's the boundary ball, Head drops short and Rossouw is quickly into position to batter a fierce cut in front of the deep cover sweeper
slightly short again, pushed through and chopped to the man in the deep for one more
length ball in the channel, tries to make a bit of room but fails to connect
good bowling, does him with the change-up, cutting his fingers over the ball to get a bit of extra bounce

short and wide and Rossouw is off his feet to crack an uppercut over backward point, gets plenty on the hot but Aaron Finch does brilliantly sliding along the rope to grab it one-handed and prevent four
angled in on the pads, clipped to short fine leg and they take on the throw

touch short and de Kock pulls, h-u-u-u-u-u-u-u-g-e top edge and it swirls above Worrall coming in at fine leg... but he holds on! It was a spectacular take in the end, diving flat out because he was slightly out of position. The burly fast bowler proves he has good hands and that's a massive wicket for Australia
drops back and lets the bouncer go
starts over the wicket but slightly leg side and Duminy flicks off his pads, into a gap and they race back
waits in the crease and plays with the spin to backward square leg this time
floated up on middle and leg, Rossouw clips through midwicket
dragged down slightly, Duminy spoons his pull slightly, in the air but well short of long-on
pushed through, goes back and pulls, along the ground to deep square leg
tossed up, on leg stump and Duminy gets down to paddle fine, possibly off the pad... Zampa appeals twice, but the umpire, Joel Wilson, presumably felt it pitched outside leg
chipped, over the bowler's arm and the head of the umpire, just a single down the ground
angled in on the stumps, Duminy prods to the on side
good pace, 141kph from Tremain, on off stump and knocked back in the direction of the bowler
dug in short and Duminy takes on the pull, not quite out of the middle but well in front of deep midwicket for three
length outside off, 143kph and sliced down to third man
comes across and punches on the up to the cover sweeper
tossed up on the stumps and prodded back to the bowler
another lbw appeal, Wade joining in this time, the ball deflects behind point... pitched outside again?
tossed up and tapped back down the track

goes for the reverse sweep, misses and the ball canons into the pads - that's out! May have been the quicker delivery from Zampa but, either way, Rossouw picked the wrong shot to play to a full, straight ball that looked to be skidding into middle and off
tossed up, maybe the googly, Miller blocks back to the bowler
pushed through on the stumps a bit quicker, Miller defends again
pushed across from over the wicket, Duminy steers through cover point
shortish, 136kph and sliced off the back foot, well stopped at backward point
comes forward and taps into the covers
fuller and straight, Miller screws his on drive to midwicket
on the stumps, Miller gets on to the front foot but finds mid-on
goes round the wicket, length outside off, Miller gets off the mark with a punch square
floated up on leg stump, turned to midwicket along the carpet
pushes this one down the leg side into Wade's pads
floated up on the stumps, this time Miller works the single to deep midwicket
pushed through and tapped back to the bowler
gives this a bit of air, angled across and Duminy skips out, drives to extra cover, who's back far enough to allow a single
tossed up outside off, goes for the reverse-dab but can't get it past short third man
flighted, outside off stump, pushed firmly to the right of mid-off and they trot the single
comes across and steers to the off-side sweeper
pitched up in the channel, driven through the covers on the walk
slightly short outside off, Miller stabs it down towards point
Miller finds extra cover with a drive on the up
slightly back of a length in the channel outside off, steered down to third man
tight line on off stump, Duminy defends
Miller's timed that pretty well! Tossed up on leg stump and he absolutely murders a flat sweep over deep midwicket
pushed through quicker on middle and off, tapped away
tossed up and that's in his wheelhouse, slogged towards wide long-on, in the air but in control and it bounces away
four more, blootered towards long-off this time! Picked the googly and opened up the body and launched it to a vacant part of the field, just one bounce to the rope
flat trajectory on the stumps, Miller pushes gently into the on side, his work done for the over
on the stumps, nudged into a gap
Duminy waits in the crease and prods a length ball through point
round the wicket, pitched up at 129kph and punched square on the walk, Finch has to run around it in the deep to throw with his left hand and Miller hurtles back for two
full outside off, driven to long-off
full again, Duminy pings a drive out of the middle but Smiffy throws himself to his right at extra cover to reel it in one-handed
presses forward and opens the face, steered to backward point
full outside off, 131kph and comes off the toe of the bat back to the bowler... hang on, they've appealed for this. The umpires confer for a bit but decide it was a bump ball. Which it was
round the wicket, pitched up and driven back to the bowler
good length, comes across and slices a drive down to third man
pitched up, 134kph in the channel, Duminy pokes it back down the ground for one
tight lines from Big John, dabbed down towards backward point
another dot, Miller moves across on off, steers a length delivery towards point
pitched up, 134kph and lashed through cover point to the sweeper
slightly back of a length, Miller waits and opens the face to steer it behind the diving Warner at backward point
fullish, Duminy creeps forwards and drives firmly wide of long-off, they come back for a second
length in the channel, Duminy opens the face and runs to third man
pitched up and driven down the ground, Miller's definitely hobbling as he heads to the non-striker's end
fullish outside off stump, punched to extra cover
taking the pace off slightly, in the channel and Duminy rocks back to guide a single to third man

slapped high into the leg side - but he's picked out the man on the rope! Oh dear, not sure what Duminy was thinking there, a short break in play and that's the partnership scuppered. Swung across the line and Finch barely had to move, a step to the left and clutched to his chest
on the stumps, Miller drops down into the on side
pitched up and punched on the move down to long-on
goes back outside off and dabs a single to third man
good-length delivery, 134kph outside off, Miller guides it to backward point - lot on his shoulders now
on the stumps and whipped with a flick of the wrists through midwicket
well if anyone is capable of something special... Miller makes a bit of room and lashes a perfectly respectable length ball several rows back over long-off! Cleaned up
goes short and Miller sits back to pull, nicely placed, swatted through an untended backward square leg
better line, 137kph on off stump, pushed square
Miller comes forward and drives a single back past the bowler
banged in short and Pretorius is not interested in playing at that
another bouncer from Worrall and Pretorius ducks it again

Miller leaves his crease and aims a slog down the ground, big appeal for a catch behind, mainly from Wade... and Australia review. Hard to see any deviation but Wade seemed pretty convinced. Is there anything on Snicko? No, not really, don't think we have Hot Spot available so it's as you were
length on off, 127kph and Miller prods down into the covers, sets off straight away - testing that ankle - and mid-off doesn't collect it cleanly
short ball, Pretorius sits in the crease and paddles it around the corner for one
length on the hips, clipped firmly but straight to square leg
fetch that, into the crowd again! Hastings is just fractionally short here and Miller latches on to an absolute beast of a flick-pull over deep midwicket
beats the bat, maybe nipped off the pitch, trying to go leg side again
a bouncer, over his head
he's nailed this one! That's a skimmer for six. Dropped in short, Pretorius saw it early and pulled it with immense power over deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched to cover
opens the face to third man
fuller, a slower ball which actually grips a little, an off-cutter, takes an inside edge into the pad
worked away off the stumps to long leg
on a length outside off, steered to third man
round the wicket, angled in at off stump, pushed towards backward point
slower delivery outside off which he runs down to third man
full and straight, flicked into midwicket
gets inside the line and tucks this off his hip through square and they do well to convert that into a couple considering Miller is limping (more so after that)
flicks a length ball to the on side, Marsh dives across but think mid-on would have stopped the single
tucked into the leg side and that takes him to a 45-ball fifty
flicked off the stumps wide of mid-on
oh dear, that's gone a bit wrong, a slower ball slips out so wide it barely hits the pitch
after going too wide outside off he then pushes this onto the legs - Miller moving around his crease - and gets flicked to fine leg
drags the length back, on off stump this time, worked into mid-on
swings a back-of-a-length delivery to deep square
uses the angle into him from round the wicket and gets another boundary, flicks this away off the stumps wide of short fine leg and beats deep square
tucked to midwicket
almost a mix-up here as this is worked towards mid-on but Miller doesn't want to move
picks out midwicket again as he flicks this off his body

the dot balls bring a wicket, Pretoious looking to work this from outside off into the leg side and gets a leading edge which loops into the covers...Warner has to take a few steps backwards, but it's simple catch
the batsmen crossed, Miller flicks this off his pads to long leg and manages to get back for a second although Lucky had to get a shift on
driven to deep cover
down the pitch outside leg stump and has a big waft at a short ball outside off
that's a lovely piece of batting, stayed in his crease, waited for the ball then open the face to glide it wide of the keeper and fine of short third man
now he goes over the off side, and there's a misfield at deep cover by Finch which makes it into a boundary...that was sloppy
flicked into square leg

big appeal for caught behind! Not given...Australia don't have a review left. Nicely bowled, in the channel outside off, was very close to the edge. Wade went up straightaway. There was a sound. Yep, Snicko shows an edge!
defended with bat and pad together to backward point
nearly defeats Miller with a slower ball but he manages to hold his shape and gets a toe end to long-off as he comes down the pitch
stays round the wicket, length ball, defended to the off side
comes onto the front foot and drives firmly to cover but it's another dot ball
another good-looking drive but he can't find a gap as he picks out mid-off
gets this one square through the off side and comes back for the second
another mistake in the field! This time Warner at midwicket as Phehlukwayo flicks this off his pads, along the ground, and it goes under the hands.
back of a length slower ball, Miller is through his shot early
driven on the up to deep cover
tight on off stump, no width to play with, defended to point
full and straight, flicked down the ground
full outside off, heaved along the ground to deep midwicket
driven to backward point
short of a length, cannons into Miller's back hip as he misses his pull...ouch, more pain for him
that's a very short bouncer which loops over Miller's head
that's big! Gets underneath a full ball and launches it straight down the ground...in the arc and he swung the line
pushed wide outside off, another extra delivery...some pressure back on Marsh
back on off stump, dabbed to backward point
can't beat backward point this time as he opens the face
driven to cover
another leading edge which loops over and wide of the bowler down to long-off
cut into the off side, can't beat point
well bowled, gets the yorker in outside off, inside edge into his pads
driven down the ground to long-off
full, speared down the leg side, missed the pads...another wide
well bowled, a slower ball, defeats Miller as he tries to drive
driven to deep cover to bring up 300
driven off the stumps to midwicket
length outside off, cut through point and cover has to get his skates on
big swing...and huge! Picks this up from outside off and lofts it clear into the stands over wide long-on...this is bubbling up nicely
over the wicket now, and fired way outside off stump...the wides are stacking up
terrific shot, Miller playing a blinder! It was a wide yorker, but Miller manages to squeeze it over backward point and split the deep fielders. A late turn of the face. Such skill
short ball, pulled powerfully out to deep square leg who manages to get his body behind it
not quite so easy for Lucky, he tries to drive this ball from outside off and it skews to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, can't beat backward point but Miller at least has the strike
crunched through the off side off the front foot, driving at the top of the bounce, wide of the sweeper
what a hundred! He keeps finding the boundary, swings away a short-of-a-length ball behind square on the leg side...a composed celebration, he knows this game is on him
an important stretch by Hastings at short third man, Miller opened the face and he almost got it through...The Duke stuck out his left hand
low, straight full toss which he can only drive to cover
what a moment for him to find the rope, that's a lovely lofted cover drive to an over-pitched wide delivery, may have been a slower ball, yes it was, and he placed it perfectly
swung hard down the ground to long-off
miscues this towards long-off, comes high off the bat, but falls into space and it gets Miller back on strike
over the wicket, a yorker at off stump, driven to deep cover
he's trying to cut loose as well now, but doesn't find the middle on this occasion, clubs this straight down the ground off somewhere near the toe end
the fielding has been a shambles in the last 20 minutes and this is another howler! Through the legs of short fine leg from nothing more than a think inside edge by Miller. That's a shocker
full, very wide, gets the toe end to cover then has to get the dive out! It's all happening. What a match
heaves a length ball into the leg side, finds long-on and he'll have the strike this time
a yorker which isn't far off getting through but he gets a thick inside edge out to deep square
full at middle and leg, clipped along the ground out to deep midwicket
priceless dot ball, slightly slower and it deceived Phehlukwayo as he went for the pull...took a bottom edge and mighty close to leg stump
what a shot! Anything Miller can do...Lucky goes up and over the off side, a wonderful inside-out lofted cover drive as he's given a hint of width
crunched out to deep cover

that's huge!!! Onto the roof at deep square leg. A magnificent pick-up shot off his legs with a effortless swing of the arms. But he was offered length which is very hittable. Still, a humongous blow. Bounced out of the ground by the looks of it
swing and a miss outside off, an appeal for a stumping and it goes upstairs...was the googly. Did he keep his foot grounded? Yes, he's well back
another dot! Phehlukwayo thinks he can bring out the reverse-paddle-sweep...he misses, and almost falls over. Miller needs to have a word
maybe Miller just said smash it! That's what he's done. Zampa dragged that down horribly and Lucky as pulled it over deep midwicket.
now he goes right across outside off and goes for the sweep, gets taken on the pad
now the reverse sweep, a single to deep cover...he's doing it his way, that's for sure
gets a dot in at Miller as he slaps this to cover, and it means he starts the next over off strike (although it may not matter)
round the wicket, short ball, he goes for the pull (or wild hoick) and gets taken on the back shoulder...bounces towards Wade and they scramble the leg bye
full and straight, drilled to long-on

that's outta here! What a stroke from Lucky. That could be the deciding blow. Hastings came round the wicket, it was on a length, and he just swung cleanly through the line to send it over wide long-on
goes for the pull, off the body again towards the keeper...South Africa won't care how they come
over the wicket, low full toss at leg stump, for a second it looked liked he middled this into the gap but it's do the man at deep midwicket
he's done it again! What an innings from the new man. Short from round the wicket and Phehlukwayo effortlessly swivels on a pull turned hooked which nearly carries all the way to fine leg
full outside off, driven sweetly to long-off...no need for anything silly
and he wins it with a reverse sweep! Gets enough bat to clear short third man and the celebrations start
